00051 #define DEBUGFLOW(c) if (debugflowsize<(DEBUGFLOWSIZE-1)) debugflow[debugflowsize++]=c
00052 #else
00053 #define DEBUGFLOW(c)

00101 /* Get periodic prints from idle loop, from clock seconds or rtimer interrupts */
00102 /* Use of rtimer will conflict with other rtimer interrupts such as contikimac radio cycling */
00103 /* STAMPS will print ENERGEST outputs if that is enabled. */
00104 #define PERIODICPRINTS 1
00105 #if PERIODICPRINTS
00106 //#define PINGS 64
00107 #define ROUTES 600
00108 #define STAMPS 60
00109 #define STACKMONITOR 1024
00110 uint32_t clocktime;
00111 #define TESTRTIMER 0
00112 #if TESTRTIMER
00113 uint8_t rtimerflag=1;
00114 struct rtimer rt;
00115 void rtimercycle(void) {rtimerflag=1;}
00116 #endif
00117 #endif
00118 
00119 uint16_t ledtimer;

00121 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00122 /*----------------------Configuration of the .elf file---------------------*/
00123 #if 1
00124 /* The proper way to set the signature is */
00125 #include <avr/signature.h>
00126 #else
00127 /* Older avr-gcc's may not define the needed SIGNATURE bytes. Do it manually if you get an error */
00128 typedef struct {const unsigned char B2;const unsigned char B1;const unsigned char B0;} __signature_t;
00129 #define SIGNATURE __signature_t __signature __attribute__((section (".signature")))
00130 SIGNATURE = {
00131   .B2 = 0x01,//SIGNATURE_2, //ATMEGA128rfa1
00132   .B1 = 0xA7,//SIGNATURE_1, //128KB flash
00133   .B0 = 0x1E,//SIGNATURE_0, //Atmel
00134 };
00135 #endif
00136 
00137 #if 1
00138 /* JTAG, SPI enabled, Internal RC osc, Boot flash size 4K, 6CK+65msec delay, brownout disabled */
00139 FUSES ={.low = 0xe2, .high = 0x99, .extended = 0xff,};
00140 #else
00141 /* JTAG+SPI, Boot 4096 words @ $F000, Internal  oscillator, startup 6 CK +0 ms, Brownout 1.8 volts */
00142 FUSES ={.low = 0xC2, .high = 0x99, .extended = 0xfe,};
00143 #endif
00144 
00145 uint8_t
00146 rng_get_uint8(void) {
00147 #if 1
00148   /* Upper two RSSI reg bits (RND_VALUE) are random in rf231 */
00149   uint8_t j;
00150   j = (PHY_RSSI>>6) | (PHY_RSSI>>4) | (PHY_RSSI>>4) | PHY_RSSI;
00151 #else
00152 /* Get a pseudo random number using the ADC */
00153   uint8_t i,j;
00154   ADCSRA=1<<ADEN;             //Enable ADC, not free running, interrupt disabled, fastest clock
00155   for (i=0;i<4;i++) {
00156     ADMUX = 0;                //toggle reference to increase noise
00157     ADMUX =0x1E;              //Select AREF as reference, measure 1.1 volt bandgap reference.
00158     ADCSRA|=1<<ADSC;          //Start conversion
00159     while (ADCSRA&(1<<ADSC)); //Wait till done
00160         j = (j<<2) + ADC;
00161   }
00162   ADCSRA=0;                   //Disable ADC
00163 #endif
00164   PRINTD("rng issues %d\n",j);
00165   return j;
00166 }
00167 
00168 /*-------------------------Low level initialization------------------------*/
00169 /*------Done in a subroutine to keep main routine stack usage small--------*/
00170 void initialize(void)
00171 {
00172   watchdog_init();
00173   watchdog_start();
00174 
00175 /* The Raven implements a serial command and data interface via uart0 to a 3290p,
00176  * which could be duplicated using another host computer.
00177  */
00178 #if !RF230BB_CONF_LEDONPORTE1   //Conflicts with USART0
00179 #ifdef RAVEN_LCD_INTERFACE
00180   rs232_init(RS232_PORT_0, USART_BAUD_38400,USART_PARITY_NONE | USART_STOP_BITS_1 | USART_DATA_BITS_8);
00181   rs232_set_input(0,raven_lcd_serial_input);
00182 #else
00183   /* Generic or slip connection on uart0 */
00184   rs232_init(RS232_PORT_0, USART_BAUD_38400,USART_PARITY_NONE | USART_STOP_BITS_1 | USART_DATA_BITS_8);
00185 #endif
00186 #endif
00187 
00188   /* Second rs232 port for debugging or slip alternative */
00189   rs232_init(RS232_PORT_1, USART_BAUD_57600,USART_PARITY_NONE | USART_STOP_BITS_1 | USART_DATA_BITS_8);
00190   /* Redirect stdout to second port */
00191   rs232_redirect_stdout(RS232_PORT_1);
00192   clock_init();
00193 
00194   if(MCUSR & (1<<PORF )) PRINTD("Power-on reset.\n");
00195   if(MCUSR & (1<<EXTRF)) PRINTD("External reset!\n");
00196   if(MCUSR & (1<<BORF )) PRINTD("Brownout reset!\n");
00197   if(MCUSR & (1<<WDRF )) PRINTD("Watchdog reset!\n");
00198   if(MCUSR & (1<<JTRF )) PRINTD("JTAG reset!\n");
00199 
00200 #if STACKMONITOR
00201   /* Simple stack pointer highwater monitor. Checks for magic numbers in the main
00202    * loop. In conjuction with PERIODICPRINTS, never-used stack will be printed
00203    * every STACKMONITOR seconds.
00204    */
00205 {
00206 extern uint16_t __bss_end;
00207 uint16_t p=(uint16_t)&__bss_end;
00208     do {
00209       *(uint16_t *)p = 0x4242;
00210       p+=10;
00211     } while (p<SP-10); //don't overwrite our own stack
00212 }
00213 #endif
00214 
00215 #define CONF_CALIBRATE_OSCCAL 0
00216 #if CONF_CALIBRATE_OSCCAL
00217 void calibrate_rc_osc_32k();
00218 {
00219 extern uint8_t osccal_calibrated;
00220 uint8_t i;
00221   PRINTD("\nBefore calibration OSCCAL=%x\n",OSCCAL);
00222   for (i=0;i<10;i++) { 
00223     calibrate_rc_osc_32k();  
00224     PRINTD("Calibrated=%x\n",osccal_calibrated);
00225 //#include <util/delay_basic.h>
00226 //#define delay_us( us )   ( _delay_loop_2(1+(us*F_CPU)/4000000UL) ) 
00227 //   delay_us(50000);
00228  }
00229    clock_init();
00230 }
00231 #endif 
00232 
00233   PRINTA("\n*******Booting %s*******\n",CONTIKI_VERSION_STRING);
00234 
00235 /* rtimers needed for radio cycling */
00236   rtimer_init();
00237 
00238  /* Initialize process subsystem */
00239   process_init();
00240 
00241   /* etimers must be started before ctimer_init */
00242   process_start(&etimer_process, NULL);
00243   ctimer_init();
00244 
00245   /* Start radio and radio receive process */
00246   NETSTACK_RADIO.init();
00247 
00248 /* Get a random seed for the 802.15.4 packet sequence number.
00249  * Some layers will ignore duplicates found in a history (e.g. Contikimac)
00250  * causing the initial packets to be ignored after a short-cycle restart.
00251  */
00252   random_init(rng_get_uint8());
00253 
00254   /* Set addresses BEFORE starting tcpip process */
00255 
00256   rimeaddr_t addr;
00257 
00258   if (params_get_eui64(addr.u8)) {
00259       PRINTA("Random EUI64 address generated\n");
00260   }
00261  
00262 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6 
00263   memcpy(&uip_lladdr.addr, &addr.u8, sizeof(rimeaddr_t));
00264 #elif WITH_NODE_ID
00265   node_id=get_panaddr_from_eeprom();
00266   addr.u8[1]=node_id&0xff;
00267   addr.u8[0]=(node_id&0xff00)>>8;
00268   PRINTA("Node ID from eeprom: %X\n",node_id);
00269 #endif  
00270   rimeaddr_set_node_addr(&addr); 
00271 
00272   rf230_set_pan_addr(params_get_panid(),params_get_panaddr(),(uint8_t *)&addr.u8);
00273   rf230_set_channel(params_get_channel());
00274   rf230_set_txpower(params_get_txpower());
00275 
00276 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00277   PRINTA("EUI-64 MAC: %x-%x-%x-%x-%x-%x-%x-%x\n",addr.u8[0],addr.u8[1],addr.u8[2],addr.u8[3],addr.u8[4],addr.u8[5],addr.u8[6],addr.u8[7]);
00278 #else
00279   PRINTA("MAC address ");
00280   uint8_t i;
00281   for (i=sizeof(rimeaddr_t); i>0; i--){
00282     PRINTA("%x:",addr.u8[i-1]);
00283   }
00284   PRINTA("\n");
00285 #endif
00286 
00287   /* Initialize stack protocols */
00288   queuebuf_init();
00289   NETSTACK_RDC.init();
00290   NETSTACK_MAC.init();
00291   NETSTACK_NETWORK.init();
00292 
00293 #if ANNOUNCE_BOOT
00294   PRINTA("%s %s, channel %u power %u",NETSTACK_MAC.name, NETSTACK_RDC.name,rf230_get_channel(),rf230_get_txpower());
00295   if (NETSTACK_RDC.channel_check_interval) {//function pointer is zero for sicslowmac
00296     unsigned short tmp;
00297     tmp=CLOCK_SECOND / (NETSTACK_RDC.channel_check_interval == 0 ? 1:\
00298                                    NETSTACK_RDC.channel_check_interval());
00299     if (tmp<65535) PRINTA(", check rate %u Hz",tmp);
00300   }
00301   PRINTA("\n");
00302 
00303 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6_RPL
00304   PRINTA("RPL Enabled\n");
00305 #endif
00306 #if UIP_CONF_ROUTER
00307   PRINTA("Routing Enabled\n");
00308 #endif
00309 
00310 #endif /* ANNOUNCE_BOOT */
00311 
00312   process_start(&tcpip_process, NULL);
00313 
00314 #ifdef RAVEN_LCD_INTERFACE
00315   process_start(&raven_lcd_process, NULL);
00316 #endif
00317 
00318   /* Autostart other processes */
00319   autostart_start(autostart_processes);
00320 
00321   /*---If using coffee file system create initial web content if necessary---*/
00322 #if COFFEE_FILES
00323   int fa = cfs_open( "/index.html", CFS_READ);
00324   if (fa<0) {     //Make some default web content
00325     PRINTA("No index.html file found, creating upload.html!\n");
00326     PRINTA("Formatting FLASH file system for coffee...");
00327     cfs_coffee_format();
00328     PRINTA("Done!\n");
00329     fa = cfs_open( "/index.html", CFS_WRITE);
00330     int r = cfs_write(fa, &"It works!", 9);
00331     if (r<0) PRINTA("Can''t create /index.html!\n");
00332     cfs_close(fa);
00333 //  fa = cfs_open("upload.html"), CFW_WRITE);
00334 // <html><body><form action="upload.html" enctype="multipart/form-data" method="post"><input name="userfile" type="file" size="50" /><input value="Upload" type="submit" /></form></body></html>
00335   }
00336 #endif /* COFFEE_FILES */
00337 
00338 /* Add addresses for testing */
00339 #if 0
00340 {  
00341   uip_ip6addr_t ipaddr;
00342   uip_ip6addr(&ipaddr, 0xaaaa, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
00343   uip_ds6_addr_add(&ipaddr, 0, ADDR_AUTOCONF);
00344 //  uip_ds6_prefix_add(&ipaddr,64,0);
00345 }
00346 #endif

00348 /*--------------------------Announce the configuration---------------------*/
00349 #if ANNOUNCE_BOOT
00350 #if AVR_WEBSERVER
00351 { uint8_t i;
00352   char buf[80];
00353   unsigned int size;
00354 
00355   for (i=0;i<UIP_DS6_ADDR_NB;i++) {
00356         if (uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].isused) {     
00357            httpd_cgi_sprint_ip6(uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].ipaddr,buf);
00358        PRINTA("IPv6 Address: %s\n",buf);
00359         }
00360   }
00361    cli();
00362    eeprom_read_block (buf,eemem_server_name, sizeof(eemem_server_name));
00363    sei();
00364    buf[sizeof(eemem_server_name)]=0;
00365    PRINTA("%s",buf);
00366    cli();
00367    eeprom_read_block (buf,eemem_domain_name, sizeof(eemem_domain_name));
00368    sei();
00369    buf[sizeof(eemem_domain_name)]=0;
00370    size=httpd_fs_get_size();
00371 #ifndef COFFEE_FILES
00372    PRINTA(".%s online with fixed %u byte web content\n",buf,size);
00373 #elif COFFEE_FILES==1
00374    PRINTA(".%s online with static %u byte EEPROM file system\n",buf,size);
00375 #elif COFFEE_FILES==2
00376    PRINTA(".%s online with dynamic %u KB EEPROM file system\n",buf,size>>10);
00377 #elif COFFEE_FILES==3
00378    PRINTA(".%s online with static %u byte program memory file system\n",buf,size);
00379 #elif COFFEE_FILES==4
00380    PRINTA(".%s online with dynamic %u KB program memory file system\n",buf,size>>10);
00381 #endif /* COFFEE_FILES */
00382 }
00383 #else
00384    PRINTA("Online\n");
00385 #endif
00386 #endif /* ANNOUNCE_BOOT */
00387 
00388 #if RF230BB_CONF_LEDONPORTE1
00389   /* NB: PORTE1 conflicts with UART0 */
00390   DDRE|=(1<<DDE1);  //set led pin to output (Micheal Hatrtman board)
00391   PORTE&=~(1<<PE1); //and low to turn led off
00392 #endif
00393 }
00394 
00395 #if ROUTES && UIP_CONF_IPV6
00396 static void
00397 ipaddr_add(const uip_ipaddr_t *addr)
00398 {
00399   uint16_t a;
00400   int8_t i, f;
00401   for(i = 0, f = 0; i < sizeof(uip_ipaddr_t); i += 2) {
00402     a = (addr->u8[i] << 8) + addr->u8[i + 1];
00403     if(a == 0 && f >= 0) {
00404       if(f++ == 0) PRINTF("::");
00405     } else {
00406       if(f > 0) {
00407         f = -1;
00408       } else if(i > 0) {
00409         PRINTF(":");
00410       }
00411       PRINTF("%x",a);
00412     }
00413   }
00414 }
00415 #endif
00416 
00417 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00418 /*------------------------- Main Scheduler loop----------------------------*/
00419 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00420 int
00421 main(void)
00422 {
00423   initialize();
00424 
00425   while(1) {
00426     process_run();
00427     watchdog_periodic();
00428 
00429     /* Turn off LED after a while */
00430     if (ledtimer) {
00431       if (--ledtimer==0) {
00432 #if RF230BB_CONF_LEDONPORTE1
00433         PORTE&=~(1<<PE1);
00434 #endif
00435 #if defined(RAVEN_LCD_INTERFACE)&&0
00436        /* ledtimer can be set by received ping; ping the other way for testing */
00437        extern void raven_ping6(void);         
00438        raven_ping6();
00439 #endif
00440       }
00441     }
00442 
00443 #if 0
00444 /* Various entry points for debugging in the AVR Studio simulator.
00445  * Set as next statement and step into the routine.
00446  */
00447     NETSTACK_RADIO.send(packetbuf_hdrptr(), 42);
00448     process_poll(&rf230_process);
00449     packetbuf_clear();
00450     len = rf230_read(packetbuf_dataptr(), PACKETBUF_SIZE);
00451     packetbuf_set_datalen(42);
00452     NETSTACK_RDC.input();
00453 #endif
00454 
00455 #if 0
00456 /* Clock.c can trigger a periodic PLL calibration in the RF230BB driver.
00457  * This can show when that happens.
00458  */
00459     extern uint8_t rf230_calibrated;
00460     if (rf230_calibrated) {
00461       PRINTD("\nRF230 calibrated!\n");
00462       rf230_calibrated=0;
00463     }
00464 #endif
00465 
00466 /* Set DEBUGFLOWSIZE in contiki-conf.h to track path through MAC, RDC, and RADIO */
00467 #if DEBUGFLOWSIZE
00468   if (debugflowsize) {
00469     debugflow[debugflowsize]=0;
00470     PRINTF("%s",debugflow);
00471     debugflowsize=0;
00472    }
00473 #endif
00474 
00475 #if PERIODICPRINTS
00476 #if TESTRTIMER
00477 /* Timeout can be increased up to 8 seconds maximum.
00478  * A one second cycle is convenient for triggering the various debug printouts.
00479  * The triggers are staggered to avoid printing everything at once.
00480  */
00481     if (rtimerflag) {
00482       rtimer_set(&rt, RTIMER_NOW()+ RTIMER_ARCH_SECOND*1UL, 1,(void *) rtimercycle, NULL);
00483       rtimerflag=0;
00484 #else
00485   if (clocktime!=clock_seconds()) {
00486      clocktime=clock_seconds();
00487 #endif
00488 
00489 #if STAMPS
00490 if ((clocktime%STAMPS)==0) {
00491 #if ENERGEST_CONF_ON
00492 #include "lib/print-stats.h"
00493         print_stats();
00494 #elif RADIOSTATS
00495 extern volatile unsigned long radioontime;
00496   PRINTF("%u(%u)s\n",clocktime,radioontime);
00497 #else
00498   PRINTF("%us\n",clocktime);
00499 #endif
00500 
00501 }
00502 #endif
00503 #if TESTRTIMER
00504       clocktime+=1;
00505 #endif
00506 
00507 #if PINGS && UIP_CONF_IPV6
00508 extern void raven_ping6(void); 
00509 if ((clocktime%PINGS)==1) {
00510   PRINTF("**Ping\n");
00511   raven_ping6();
00512 }
00513 #endif
00514 
00515 #if ROUTES && UIP_CONF_IPV6
00516 if ((clocktime%ROUTES)==2) {
00517       
00518 extern uip_ds6_nbr_t uip_ds6_nbr_cache[];
00519 extern uip_ds6_route_t uip_ds6_routing_table[];
00520 extern uip_ds6_netif_t uip_ds6_if;
00521 
00522   uint8_t i,j;
00523   PRINTF("\nAddresses [%u max]\n",UIP_DS6_ADDR_NB);
00524   for (i=0;i<UIP_DS6_ADDR_NB;i++) {
00525     if (uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].isused) {
00526       ipaddr_add(&uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].ipaddr);
00527       PRINTF("\n");
00528     }
00529   }
00530   PRINTF("\nNeighbors [%u max]\n",UIP_DS6_NBR_NB);
00531   for(i = 0,j=1; i < UIP_DS6_NBR_NB; i++) {
00532     if(uip_ds6_nbr_cache[i].isused) {
00533       ipaddr_add(&uip_ds6_nbr_cache[i].ipaddr);
00534       PRINTF("\n");
00535       j=0;
00536     }
00537   }
00538   if (j) PRINTF("  <none>");
00539   PRINTF("\nRoutes [%u max]\n",UIP_DS6_ROUTE_NB);
00540   for(i = 0,j=1; i < UIP_DS6_ROUTE_NB; i++) {
00541     if(uip_ds6_routing_table[i].isused) {
00542       ipaddr_add(&uip_ds6_routing_table[i].ipaddr);
00543       PRINTF("/%u (via ", uip_ds6_routing_table[i].length);
00544       ipaddr_add(&uip_ds6_routing_table[i].nexthop);
00545  //     if(uip_ds6_routing_table[i].state.lifetime < 600) {
00546         PRINTF(") %lus\n", uip_ds6_routing_table[i].state.lifetime);
00547  //     } else {
00548  //       PRINTF(")\n");
00549  //     }
00550       j=0;
00551     }
00552   }
00553   if (j) PRINTF("  <none>");
00554   PRINTF("\n---------\n");
00555 }
00556 #endif
00557 
00558 #if STACKMONITOR
00559 if ((clocktime%STACKMONITOR)==3) {
00560   extern uint16_t __bss_end;
00561   uint16_t p=(uint16_t)&__bss_end;
00562   do {
00563     if (*(uint16_t *)p != 0x4242) {
00564       PRINTF("Never-used stack > %d bytes\n",p-(uint16_t)&__bss_end);
00565       break;
00566     }
00567     p+=10;
00568   } while (p<RAMEND-10);
00569 }
00570 #endif
00571 
00572     }
00573 #endif /* PERIODICPRINTS */
00574 
00575 #if RF230BB&&0
00576 extern uint8_t rf230processflag;
00577     if (rf230processflag) {
00578       PRINTF("rf230p%d",rf230processflag);
00579       rf230processflag=0;
00580     }
00581 #endif
00582 
00583 #if RF230BB&&0
00584 extern uint8_t rf230_interrupt_flag;
00585     if (rf230_interrupt_flag) {
00586  //   if (rf230_interrupt_flag!=11) {
00587         PRINTF("**RI%u",rf230_interrupt_flag);
00588  //   }
00589       rf230_interrupt_flag=0;
00590     }
00591 #endif
00592   }
00593   return 0;
00594 }
00595

00597 
00598 void log_message(char *m1, char *m2)
00599 {
00600   PRINTF("%s%s\n", m1, m2);
00601 }
